page.title: 12Local Opinions
page.content: Despite the lack of amenities the general opinion of the residents,from teenagers to pensioners,is that the area should retain it's peaceful rural atmosphere.As no form of expansion has been planned for the forseeable future and only infilling is allowed for house building,there is no cause for alarm. In the opinion of the farmers,life has become more difficult in recent years.The increase in labour costs has reduced the number of employees.A farm that once supported 3 families now supports one.The{E.E.C farm policies,} particularly over milk quotas have caused great bitterness.To quote a lady farmer,"We used to have a small efficient low cost herd,but with the introduction of milk quotas,our quota was too small to make dairy products economically viable."
